item.title: Yet another Fibonacci
item.description: One of the most interesting algorithms is the Fibonacci numbers. It’s pretty tricky ’cause it might leads to a binary tree recursion…

item.title: Software plants
item.description: It’s very common the analogy between software “factory” and the civil sector… Nothing could be futher from reality.

item.title: *Variance analogy
item.description: The other day, talking to some coworkers, I realised developers unacquainted to functional programming feel hard to understand type covariance and contravariance concepts.

item.title: Worth in the computing development milieu
item.description: The worth concept is very subjective and private. Everyone has its own, and it diverges one from another.

item.title: Passion for technology
item.description: I’ve seen a lot of job ads that include the works “passionate about technology.”

item.title: Lies they’ve been telling you about functional programming
item.description: Functional programming aims to implement the λ-calculus as a programming environment.

item.title: Ruby is a toy language
item.description: Yesterday I was having lunch with some developers, and one of them (a Ruby one) began to bash some bad attributes of that technology.

item.title: The great VM Misconception
item.description: There’s a well accepted idea that the best multiplatform development approach can be no other than virtual machine.

item.title: Implementing OOP on Fish (just for fun)
item.description: Fish is a great command-line shell targeted on programmers.

item.title: Testing the steering wheel in an engine missing car
item.description: Our motor vehicle assembler is designing a new car concept. Everything works in slightly different ways than the usual.

item.title: Back to the Cult of Action for Action’s Sake
item.description: In I.T. we’re living an odd age, when people worship the entrepreneurship for itself.

item.title: Now we have two…
item.description: We had some problems to solve. The technical management decided we should use Ruby. Now we have bigger ones.

item.title: Why Lombok is a waste of time
item.description: The Lombok’s goal is to add facilities and syntax sugar to (…) Java.

item.title: Palíndromo em Standard ML
item.description: Estive pensando em uma forma de explicar functor de ML, cheguei ao algoritmo de determinação de palíndromo.

item.title: Concern em Python em 15 minutos
item.description: Um recurso bacana em Ruby é concern…

item.title: Konsulta Vortaro on-line
item.description: Como exercício de ML, decidi escrever uma versão on-line do Konsulta Vortaro.

item.title: Uma brincadeira rápida
item.description: Um jeito divertido de calcular Fibonacci usando NumPy.

item.title: Smackage
item.description: Há uns meses descobri um projeto muito bacana para gerenciamento de pacotes Standard ML.

item.title: Sendo honesto em Typescript
item.description: Recentemente comecei minhas aventuras em Typescript e percebi algo importante…

item.title: Diferença entre dado binário e dado textual
item.description: Às vezes percebo que as pessoas apresentam dificuldade em entender a diferença entre um protocol texto e outro binário.
